Detailed Description

This module controls the BlueTooth communication with the SPAM paired with the server.

We use LibBluez to communicate via BlueTooth, please refer to "An introduction to BlueTooth Programming" ( http://people.csail.mit.edu/albert/bluez-intro/) to get an idea on how LibBluez works.

Define Documentation

#define BT_INQUIRY_LEN   8

Lenght of the BlueTooth Inquiry.

This time is not in seconds but in 1.28 seconds. Beats me why they have chosen to this, however it is discussed on the BlueZ tutorial here: http://people.csail.mit.edu/albert/bluez-intro/c404.html

#define MAX_BT_DEVICES   255

Maximum nuber of BlueTooth Devices discoverable.

Parameters:

Returns:
Bytes received.
Return values:
-1 if there was any problem.

Returns:
Result of the operation
Return values:
0 if the closing was succesful.
-1 if there was any problem.
int bro_bt_connect_device ( int *  spam_sock,
bdaddr_t  mac_addr 
)

Connect to the given device.

The connection is done using a bdaddr_t parameter since it is possible to connect to a BlueTooth device knowing only the MAC address, since one of the connecting options for the BROFist server is to pass directly the MAC address at the startup.

Parameters:
spam_sock Pointer to the SPAM Socket Descriptor.
mac_addr MAC Address of the Device to connect to.
Returns:
Result of the operation
Return values:
0 if the connection was succesful.
-1 if there were problems in the connection.
Note:
If there were errors with the connection then errno will be set accordingly to the return values listed on the "man 2 connect" page.
size_t bro_bt_scan_devices ( bro_bt_device_t *  devices[MAX_BT_DEVICES]  ) 

Discover all the BT Devices in range and then put their details in an array.

Bla.

Parameters:
devices[MAX_BT_DEVICES] Array that will contains al the Devices Found.
Returns:
Number of Devices found.
Return values:
-1 if any connection error emerged.
